text: Faristenia mukurossivora is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in Japan (Honshu).Faristenia at funet The length of the forewings is 6.2-6.8 mm for males and 6.5-7.4 mm for females. The forewings are dark brownish grey with dense whitish grey irroration and with scattered blackish scales. There are five fuscous marks on the costa, a large, obscure fuscous mark on the cell and blackish small dots near the apex. The hindwings are pale brownish grey, scattered with ochreous.Trans. lepid. Soc. Japan 51 (2) : 122 The larvae feed on Sapindus mukurossi. ==References== Category:Faristenia Category:Moths described in 2000
title: Faristenia mukurossivora
